> How does Jtest work? 

I think "How well does JTest work" would be a much more interesting
question. And IMO it can only be answered by trying it.

So, please try it for a reasonable time (say, half a year) - and try
Junit for a similiar amount of time. If you *then* report back here with
your experiences, you will probably find a very interested audience.

Until then, all your points are mere speculation - and not very
interesting ones, to actual practitioners.

Regards, Ilja

PS: Personally, I am not very inclined trying out Jtest - simply because
I *like* working test-driven. YMMV.
